SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Urban Shoppers relative to International Customers?
SRP.A: Urban Shoppers is {below} International Customers in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total online sales volume?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Subscription Members}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total online sales volume?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Urban Shoppers}.

VE.Q: What are the online sales volume of Budget Shoppers, Urban Shoppers, and Luxury Consumers in 1964?

SC.Q: What is the average total Online Sales Volume?

NF.Q: Which years did the total Online Sales Volume go below 33400891.02 $? Please list the years and corresponding total values.

NC.Q: Between 1971 and 1982, was the average total Online Sales Volume higher or lower than between 1955 and 1959?
NC.A: The average total online sales volume between 1971 and 1982 was {lower} than between 1955 and 1959.

NC.Q: Between 1965 and 1977, did the total Online Sales Volume experience a larger or smaller change than between 1961 and 1969?
NC.A: The change in total online sales volume between 1965 and 1977 was {smaller} than between 1961 and 1969.

NC.Q: Between 1980 and 1981, was the average total Online Sales Volume higher or lower than between 1971 and 1977?
NC.A: The average total online sales volume between 1980 and 1981 was {higher} than between 1971 and 1977.

NC.Q: Between 1965 and 1967, was the average total Online Sales Volume higher or lower than between 1975 and 1979?
NC.A: The average total online sales volume between 1965 and 1967 was {lower} than between 1975 and 1979.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {Subscription Members} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Urban Shoppers, Budget Shoppers, Millennials, International Customers, Luxury Consumers, Rural Buyers, Subscription Members}.
